item.title: 戴尔公司的乐观预测进一步证明，人工智能应用的兴起正在推动企业技术供应商的收益，也为华尔街的狂热增添了一抹亮色。更多信息
item.description:
Dell’s upbeat forecast provides further evidence that rising #AI adoption is driving gains across enterprise technology vendors, and adds to the frenzy on Wall Street. Read more: https://t.co/qyhS44xelE pic.twitter.com/1Fx522HO6l

— Reuters Business (@ReutersBiz) March 2, 2024

item.title: 观看：美国股市上涨，S&P 500 指数和纳斯达克指数创下收盘新高，原因是人工智能引领的另一波反弹提振了市场，而国债收益率下降则提供了进一步支撑
item.description:
WATCH: US stocks rose with the S&P 500 and Nasdaq notching closing highs, as another AI-led rally boosted markets, while a fall in Treasury yields provided further support https://t.co/qKNS8qKQw6 pic.twitter.com/t83OGYoGZ8

— Reuters Business (@ReutersBiz) March 2, 2024

item.title: 波音公司需要在 90 天内制定出解决质量控制问题的计划；索尼公司 PlayStation 游戏部门的裁员人数约为 900 人；法航-荷航股价暴跌超过 10%--即使该公司公布了创纪录的收入。本周数字及其他
item.description:
Boeing has 90 days to come up with a plan to tackle quality control issues; about 900 is how many jobs are going at Sony’s PlayStation gaming unit and over 10% was the plunge in shares for Air France-KLM - even as it posted record revenues. This and more in the Week in Numbers pic.twitter.com/MjhvD1ZxKG

— Reuters Business (@ReutersBiz) March 2, 2024

item.title: 来自 @Breakingviews：丽贝卡-克里斯蒂（Rebecca Christie）说，随着欧盟对核能的热情高涨，为了避免在小型核反应堆方面 "落后于形势"，欧洲投资银行的融资将发挥重要作用 #BVTV
item.description:
From @Breakingviews: For the European Union to avoid getting 'behind the curve' on small nuclear reactors, as it gets excited about nuclear power, European Investment Bank financing can make a difference, says Rebecca Christie #BVTV pic.twitter.com/1oeeOFKlx9

— Reuters Business (@ReutersBiz) March 1, 2024

item.title: 戴尔科技公司（Dell Technologies）发布乐观的年度预测，表示这家科技设备制造商将从人工智能（AI）热潮中获益，随后该公司股价大涨 25%，创下历史新高。更多信息
item.description:
Dell Technologies shares surged 25% to hit a record high following an upbeat annual forecast that indicated the tech equipment maker was benefiting from the #AI boom. Read more: https://t.co/qyhS44xMbc pic.twitter.com/3yS0XiBXsk

— Reuters Business (@ReutersBiz) March 1, 2024

item.title: 尼日利亚将根据中央银行的新指导方针取缔街头外汇交易；加纳国营电力供应商因180万美元的债务而短暂切断了议会大楼的电力供应，等等。以下是本周非洲最重要的商业新闻
item.description:
Nigeria to outlaw street-trading of foreign currency under new guidelines by the central bank; Ghana's state-run electricity supplier briefly cut power supplies to the parliament building over a $1.8 million debt, and more. Here are the top business stories from Africa this week pic.twitter.com/idqJU2wQKr

— Reuters Business (@ReutersBiz) March 1, 2024

item.title: 过去一年，在房地产危机的影响下，中国经济增长乏力，消费者暂缓消费，外资企业撤资，制造商苦苦寻找买家，地方政府背负着沉重的债务负担。更多信息
item.description:
China has been grappling with sub-par growth over the past year amid a property crisis and as consumers hold off spending, foreign firms divest, manufacturers struggle for buyers, and local governments contend with huge debt burdens. Read more: https://t.co/89aMQFRQxW pic.twitter.com/hZsTTf98GH

— Reuters Business (@ReutersBiz) March 1, 2024

item.title: 来自 @Breakingviews：欧盟对核电越来越感兴趣，而 Nadia Calviño 的欧洲投资银行可以提供帮助。丽贝卡-克里斯蒂（Rebecca Christie）认为，为了避免欧盟在小型核反应堆方面 "落后于形势"，欧洲投资银行的融资可以发挥重要作用 #BVTV
item.description:
From @Breakingviews: The European Union is getting excited about nuclear power, and Nadia Calviño’s European Investment Bank can help. For the EU to avoid getting 'behind the curve' on small nuclear reactors, EIB financing can make a difference, Rebecca Christie argues #BVTV pic.twitter.com/flu2WnRGEl

— Reuters Business (@ReutersBiz) March 1, 2024

item.title: 观看：特斯拉正在中国加强电动汽车价格战。该公司为购车者推出了一系列新的优惠措施。在三月底之前从库存中购买新车的人现在可以获得价值高达约4800美元的优惠。
item.description:
WATCH: Tesla is stepping up a price war over electric cars in China. The firm rolled out a range of new incentives for buyers. People picking up new cars from stock by the end of March can now get perks worth up to around $4,800 https://t.co/JIJUKjeBw8 pic.twitter.com/FgHn4gGfVg

— Reuters Business (@ReutersBiz) March 1, 2024

item.title: 印度 Paytm 支付银行因涉嫌洗钱被罚款超过 66.2 万美元
item.description:

— Reuters Business (@ReutersBiz) March 1, 2024

item.title: Meta Platforms 表示，它将停止为 Facebook 上出现的内容向澳大利亚新闻出版商支付费用，从而与堪培拉展开新一轮较量。更多信息
item.description:
Meta Platforms said it will stop paying Australian news publishers for content that appears on Facebook, setting up a fresh battle with Canberra which had led the world with a law that forces internet giants to strike licensing deals. Read more https://t.co/923MXgdR6W pic.twitter.com/9I6A5XpOTD

— Reuters Business (@ReutersBiz) March 1, 2024
